title: Consumer Price Index of all urban consumers , by region 2019
summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) in the y axis.
Country West has the highest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) and Midwest has the lowest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984).
The Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) of Country West is 1.14% larger than the minimum value at Midwest.
min_summary: This bar chart has 5 columns on the x axis representing Country, and Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) in each Country on the y axis.
The maximum Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) 270.35 is found at Country West and the minimum is found at Midwest where Country is 237.78.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) in the y axis.
Country West has the highest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) and Midwest has the lowest Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984).
The Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) of Country West is 1.14% larger than the minimum value at Midwest.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Country in the x axis and Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) in the y axis.
The Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984) is highest at Country West and lowest at Country Midwest.
Country Northeast has the second highest value for Consumer Price Index (100=1982-1984).
There is a difference of 32.57 between the maximum Country West and minimum Country Midwest.
Country West is higher than any other Countrys with value 270.35, followed by Northeast, and U.S. city average. Down to Country Midwest with the lowest value 237.78.
The highest value 270.35 at West is almost 1.06 times larger than the average value 255.89.
Summing up the values of all Countrys, we get total 1279.45.
